Accesses the real part of the complex number. 

@1@ Returns the real part.

@2@ Sets the real part to {{c|value}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|value|the value to set the real part to}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
@1@ The real part of {{c|*this}}.

@2@ (none)

===Notes===
In C++11, overload {{v|1}} in {{lc|std::complex}} specializations used to be specified without {{c/core|const}} qualifier. However, in C++11, a {{ltt|cpp/language/constexpr}} specifier used in a non-static member function implies {{c/core|const}}, and thus the behavior is as if {{c/core|const}} is specified.
